Geol.GeolDesc: Loose SAND
Stiff to very stiff CLAY
Very loose to loose SAND
Very dense SAND
Stiff to very stiff CLAY
Medium dense SAND
Stiff to very stiff CLAY with occasional bands of SAND
Loose to medium dense clayey SAND
Firm CLAY
Stiff becoming very stiff slightly sandy CLAY
MADE GROUND. Dark brown organic sandy clay with rootlets.

MADE GROUND. Dark brown slightly organic silty gravelly sand with occasional boulders. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint, brick and concrete. Boulders are of concrete (<400mm).

MADE GROUND. Brown slightly silty gravelly sand with occasional pockets (<20mm) of brown clay. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint, chalk, brick and concrete (<50mm). Driller noted with concrete cobble fill.

MADE GROUND. Slightly friable orangish brown sandy slightly gravelly clay with occasional carbonaceous material (<5mm). Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of white, grey and brown flint and brick.
MADE GROUND. Slightly friable greyish brown sandy slightly gravelly clay. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of black, grey and white flint (<40mm), chalk and brick (<10mm).
Firm orangish brown sandy slightly gravelly CLAY with occasional lenses (<5mm) of yellowish brown sand. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of brown, black and white flint.

Medium dense yellowish brown slightly silty sandy GRAVEL with occasional cobbles and occasional pockets (<20mm) of sandy clay. Gravel is angular to rounded, fine to coarse of brown, black and white flint. Cobbles are angular to subrounded of flint (<70mm).
Firm brown sandy slightly gravelly CLAY. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine and medium of brown flint.

Stiff indistinctly fissured greyish brown slightly sandy CLAY with occasional burrows (<2mm) infilled with black silt and occasional dustings of black silt. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and undulating, occasionally polished. Unit A3ii.
Firm fissured brown silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, smooth and polished. Unit A3ii.

Stiff locally fissured brown silty CLAY with occasional partings and dustings of yellowish brown fine sand and occasional pockets and lenses (<10mm) of light brown sand. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, predominantly horizontal and subhorizontal. Unit A3ii.
Very stiff brown silty CLAY with occasional pockets and lenses (2mm) and occasional partings and dustings of light brown fine sand. Unit A3ii.

Very stiff locally fissured silty CLAY with rare partings and dustings of light brown fine sand. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, occasionally subvertical, planar, smooth and polished. Unit A3i.

Very stiff locally fissured silty CLAY with rare partings and dustings of light brown fine sand. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, occasionally subvertical, planar, smooth and polished. Unit A2.

Very stiff locally fissured brown, locally slightly sandy, silty CLAY, locally with frequent pockets and lenses (<15mm) and occasional bands (<10mm) of light brown fine sand, occasional pyrite nodules (<15mm) and rare foraminifera. Fissures are possibly closely to widely spaced, subvertical, smooth and polished. Unit A2.

Very stiff and hard thinly laminated grey CLAY with occasional layers, pockets or lenses (<5mm) and partings and dustings of light grey fine sand, occasional lenses (<2mm) of black lignite and rare pyrite nodules (5mmx25mm). Locally with shells or shell fragments (<10mm).
Hard cemented grey CLAY / very weak MUDSTONE with bivalve shells and shell fragments (<20mm). (Possible Paludina Band).
Hard cemented grey CLAY with some bivalve shells (20mm).

Hard friable fissured greyish blue mottled red and brown silty CLAY. 1. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, smooth and polished. 2. Fissures are possibly closely spaced, inclined (40 - 60 degrees), planar and polished.
Locally interlaminated greyish brown SAND with thinly laminated grey CLAY. Sand is fine and medium.
Very stiff laminated dark grey CLAY with shells and shell fragments (<20mm) and occasional partings of fine sand.
ASSESSED ZONE OF CORE LOSS (due to pressuremeter test).

Hard friable fissured grey mottled purple, red, brown, green and yellow locally silty CLAY. 1. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, polished and smooth. 2. Fissures are possibly medium to widely spaced, inclined (40 - 60 degrees), polished and striated.
GRAVEL. Gravel is rounded, medium and coarse of predominantly brown, white, grey and green flint.
Very stiff and hard greyish blue mottled brown and red slightly sandy, gravelly, silty CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is rounded, medium and coarse of brown and grey flint.
Very stiff green locally brownish green slightly sandy slightly gravelly glauconitic CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is rounded, medium and coarse of brown, grey and orange flint.

Greenish grey mottled orangish brown locally clayey slightly gravelly glauconitic SAND with occasional pockets and lenses (<5mm) of grey clay and sandy clay and occasional shell fragments (<8mm). Sand is fine. Gravel is rounded and medium of black flint.
Brownish grey SAND. Sand is predominantly fine.
Clayey sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is angular to rounded, medium and coarse of black flint.

Very weak and weak low and medium density, locally high density, creamish white CHALK with occasional grey burrows (<60mm), regular flint bands, frequent flints. Fractures are predominantly widely spaced, subhorizontal, rarely inclined (30 degrees) and subvertical, closed, planar, smooth and rough, clean. With occasional zones (<250mm) with fractured extremely weak friable chalk. Cuckmere Beds. Grade A1.

Weak locally very weak medium density white CHALK with occasional grey burrows (<100mm), regular flint bands, frequent flints and occasional sponge pockets (<5mm). Fractures are widely spaced, predominantly subhorizontal, open (<1mm), planar, smooth, infilled with white comminuted chalk. Cuckmere Beds. Grade B1.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown organic sandy clay with rootlets.

MADE GROUND. Dark brown slightly organic silty gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine to coarse of flint with occasional brick and concrete. Cobbles are of brick and concrete fragments (<110mm).
MADE GROUND. Brick, rubble, clay and gravel fill. (Driller's description).
Brown SAND and GRAVEL. (Driller's description). Possibly River Terrace Desposits.
Stiff brown silty CLAY. (Driller's description). Possibly London Clay Formation.
Stiff grey silty CLAY. (Driller's description). Possibly London Clay Formation.
MADE GROUND. Tarmacadam.

MADE GROUND. Light brown sandy gravel with occasional cobbles. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine to coarse of flint and limestone with some brick fragments (<50mm). Cobbles are angular and subangular of brick (<120mm).
MADE GROUND. Brown slightly gravelly sand with occasional pockets (<35mm) of brown sandy clay. Gravel is predominantly angular of brick, ceramic tile, glass and clinker fragments (<70mm).
MADE GROUND. Dark grey gravelly sand. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint with occasional brick and ceramic tile fragments (<40mm).
MADE GROUND. Dark grey sandy slightly gravelly clay. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine to coarse of flint with brick and clinker and rare granite fragments (<40mm).
MADE GROUND. Brown clayey gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint. Cobbles are subangular of flint (<75mm). Driller noted with brick fill.
Medium dense becoming very dense brown sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is subangular to rounded fine to coarse of flint.
Firm brown slightly gravelly CLAY with occasional pockets (<30mm) of brown sand. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint. Unit A3.
Firm becoming stiff indistinctly fissured dark grey CLAY with some mica. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating and rough. Unit A3.
Stiff becoming very stiff, fissured, dark brown, silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and clean. Unit A3.
Very stiff fissured dark brown silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and clean. Unit A2.
Very stiff dark brown to light brown silty sandy CLAY with abundant pockets (<7mm) of sand and occasional foraminifera (<1mm). Sand is fine and medium. Unit A2.
Very stiff dark brown and greenish grey silty CLAY with rare pyrite (<20mm), rare white fine sand sized possibly micaceous speckling and shell fragments (<5mm). Unit A2.
Very stiff dark brown CLAY with abundant shell fragments (<15mm) (possible bivalve).

Very stiff, dark greyish green sandy slightly gravelly CLAY with occasional shell fragments (<10mm) (possible bivalve). Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine and medium of flint.
Dark greyish brown, very shelly MUDSTONE thinly laminated with cemented shells (<20mm) (possible bivalve). (Possible Palludina Band).
Very stiff brownish grey slightly sandy CLAY with abundant shell fragments (<10mm), occasionally cemented. Sand is fine and medium.
Very stiff brown and red mottled orange, slightly sandy CLAY. Sand is fine.
Very stiff fissured orangish brown mottled bluish grey CLAY. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, smooth, clean and striated.
Very stiff mottled light brown and grey slightly sandy CLAY with occasional pockets (<5mm) of stiff grey clay.
Very stiff grey, green and brown clayey SILT with occasional pockets (<10mm) of greyish brown silty sand and occasional black carbonaceous material (possibly laminated).

Very stiff possibly fissured, greyish brown thinly laminated slightly sandy CLAY and silty SAND with occasional shell fragments (<10mm). Sand is fine and medium. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and clean.
Very stiff dark greyish brown mottled orange slightly sandy silty CLAY with abundant shell fragments. Sand is fine and medium.
Very stiff brown and red mottled orange sandy CLAY with abundant pockets (<10mm) of silty sand and occasional pockets (<2mm) of weak white and creamish white calcrete.

Very stiff fissured brown and red mottled orange sandy CLAY with slight bioturbation, infilled with silty fine sand. Sand is fine and medium. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and rough.
MADE GROUND. Tarmacadam.

MADE GROUND. Light brown and grey slightly clayey sandy gravel with occasional cobbles. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine to coarse of flint and limestone with some brick fragments (<60mm). Cobbles are of brick (<140mm).

MADE GROUND. Dark grey sandy gravel with occasional cobbles and occasional pockets (<30mm) of grey clay. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint with some brick fragments (<50mm). Cobbles are of brick (<150mm). Slight hydrocarbon odour.
MADE GROUND. Dark grey and black clayey slightly gravelly sand. Sand is fine. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine to coarse of flint with ash, brick and clinker fragments (<35mm).
MADE GROUND. Brown sandy gravelly silt fill. (Driller's description).
MADE GROUND. Brown locally black slightly sandy slightly gravelly clay. Gravel is angular to rounded fine to coarse of brown, white, black and red flint. Driller noted fill.
Orangish brown sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint.

Dense orangish brown slightly clayey sandy GRAVEL with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of brown and grey flint. Cobbles are subangular of brown and grey flint (<75mm).

Firm, fissured, indistinctly laminated, greyish brown, silty CLAY with a little mica, possibly thinly interlaminated with partings of light brown and green silt. Fissures are possibly very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated and smooth. Unit A3.

Stiff, indistinctly fissured, brown silty CLAY with a little mica and occasional partings of light brown and grey silt. Fissures are possibly very closely to closely spaced, randomly orientated and smooth. Unit A3.

Stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with a little mica and occasional partings of light brown and grey silt. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and smooth. Unit A3.

Stiff becoming very stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with a little mica and occasional burrows infilled with light brown fine sand. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, subhorizontal and vertical, planar, smooth and tight. Unit A3.

Very stiff, indistinctly laminated, greyish brown, slightly sandy silty CLAY, possibly thinly interlaminated with partings of silt, rare burrows (<1mm) infilled with greenish grey silt and rare pyrite nodules (<10mm). Unit A2.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with rare burrows infilled with light brown silt and rare bioturbation (<2mm) infilled with greenish grey silt. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, horizontal and vertical, planar, smooth and tight. Unit A2.

Very stiff indistinctly thinly laminated greenish grey sandy glauconitic CLAY with burrows infilled with light grey silt, and grey shelly sandy slightly gravelly CLAY with rare pyrite nodules (<30mm). Gravel is rounded, medium and coarse of black flint.
Very stiff greenish grey sandy CLAY with some bivalve shells and shell fragments (<15mm).
Very stiff fissured mottled red, blue, grey and yellowish brown slightly sandy CLAY. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, tight, polished and striated.
Dense greenish grey and greenish brown very silty SAND with pockets of very sandy silt. Sand is fine.
Very stiff dark grey silty CLAY thinly interlaminated with partings of light grey SILT.

Very stiff thinly laminated dark grey silty CLAY with occasional partings of light grey silt, locally with pockets of (<30mm) of green silty clay, occasional shell fragments (<20mm) and occasional fragments (<15mm) of weak white calcrete.
Very stiff dark grey silty CLAY with subangular fragments (<80mm) of weak white calcrete.
Very stiff fissured mottled red, green, yellow and purple slightly sandy CLAY. Fissures are possibly closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, smooth and polished.
Dense orangish brown fine to coarse SAND and angular to rounded fine to coarse GRAVEL of brown, grey, black and white flint. (RIVER TERRACE DEPOSITS)

Medium dense multicoloured sandy angular to rounded fine to coarse GRAVEL of brown, grey, black and white flint with low cobble content. Sand is fine to coarse. Cobbles are subangular to subrounded of dark grey, brown and black flint. (RIVER TERRACE DEPOSITS)

Stiff fissured brownish grey CLAY with occasional burrows infilled with greenish grey silt (<1mm diameter by 4-6mm long). Fissures are: 1) extremely closely to very closely spaced subhorizontal planar smooth closed locally polished. 2) extremely closely to very closely spaced subvertical planar smooth closely locally polished. (LONDON CLAY FORMATION - B)

Stiff fissured brownish grey CLAY with extremely closely to very closely spaced thin impersistent partings of light brownish grey very silty fine sand. Locally with occasional randomly orientated burrows infilled with greenish grey silt (1mm diameter by up to 15mm long). Fissures are: 1) extremely closely to very closely spaced subhorizontal planar smooth closed locally polished. 2) extremely closely to very closely spaced subvertical planar smooth closed locally polished. (LONDON CLAY FORMATION - A3ii)
Stiff to very stiff fissured brownish grey CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely to very closely spaced randomly orientated planar smooth closed. (LONDON CLAY FORMATION - A3i)

Very stiff fissured brownish grey CLAY with occasional randomly orientated burrows infilled with greenish grey silt (1mm diameter by up to 15mm long) and with occasional locally many light grey and white silt tubes (1-4mm) (foraminifera). Fissures are: 1) extremely closely to closely spaced subhorizontal planar smooth closed locally polished. 2) extremely closely to very closely spaced subvertical planar smooth closed locally polished. (LONDON CLAY FORMATION - A2)
Stiff brownish grey locally dark green glauconitic sandy silty CLAY with many fine to medium gravel sized white shell fragments. (HARWICH FORMATION - SWANSCOMBE MEMBER)

Very stiff grey slightly sandy CLAY with extremely closely locally closely spaced thin partings of grey fine to medium sand (<100mm) and occasional fine to medium gravel sized white and cream shell fragments. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER SHELLY BEDS)
Very stiff grey slightly sandy CLAY with many white and brown shell fragments (1-2mm diameter by 1-6mm long). Sand is fine and medium. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER SHELLY BEDS)
Hard brownish grey CLAY with some fine to coarse gravel sized white shell fragments. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER SHELLY BEDS)

MADE GROUND. Brown slightly organic silty gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint, brick and concrete. Cobbles are of brick and concrete (<120mm).
MADE GROUND. Light grey concrete.
MADE GROUND. Brown and grey slightly clayey sandy gravel and cobbles. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint and brick. Cobbles are angular to subrounded of brick (<100mm).
Medium dense orangish brown clayey slightly gravelly SAND with coarse gravel and cobble sized pockets of clay. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint.
Dense and very dense orangish brown, greyish brown and white sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint.
Recovered as soft greyish brown slightly gravelly CLAY. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine to coarse of flint.

Firm and stiff greyish brown locally fissured CLAY with rare partings (<1mm) of grey silt and fine brown sand. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and occasionally undulating. Unit A3.

Stiff and very stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY with occasional fine sand sized selenite crystals and rare partings (<1mm) of grey silt and fine and medium brown sand. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated and planar. Unit A3.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY with occasional foraminifera, rare shell fragments, rare partings (<1mm) of grey silt, and rare fine sand sized selenite crystals. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated and planar. Unit A3.

Very stiff fissured grey slightly sandy CLAY with occasional fine sand sized selenite crystals, occasional light grey burrows (1mmx20mm), occasional partings of grey silt and fine and medium brown sand, with rare shell fragments. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, predominantly subhorizontal and undulating. Unit A2.
Moderately strong grey MUDSTONE recovered as cobbles in dark grey clay matrix with a silty texture. Cobbles are angular.
Stiff and very stiff, locally thinly laminated, dark brownish grey CLAY, locally with some shell fragments and locally with extremely closely spaced partings of light grey fine sand.
Bluish grey slightly sandy SILT. Sand is fine.
Very stiff fissured friable brown mottled bluish grey becoming mottled grey, brown and red CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, smooth and polished.
Brown SAND thinly bedded with thin laminae of grey and brown slightly sandy silty CLAY. Sand is fine and medium.
Thinly interlaminated brown SAND and grey sandy CLAY, with occasional bivalve shells and shell fragments (<10mm).
Very stiff thinly laminated brownish grey CLAY with occasional to frequent shells and occasional pockets (<20mm) and lenses (<5mm) of light brown fine sand.
Very stiff fissured brown mottled grey and purple silty CLAY with nodules (predominantly <10mm) of calcrete.
Very stiff fissured mottled brown, grey, purple and blue CLAY. Fissures are closely spaced randomly orientated, polished, striated and sheared.
Very stiff slightly sandy slightly gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular to rounded fine and medium of brown, grey and white flint.

Stiff mottled green and brown slightly sandy slightly gravelly CLAY with occasional pockets (<5mm) of greenish grey sand. Sand is fine. Gravel is subangular to rounded fine to coarse of white, grey, brown and black flint.
Very stiff brown CLAY interlaminated with thin laminae of grey fine SAND with lenses (<5mm) of green clay.
Mottled greenish brown, bluish grey, yellow and red slightly clayey SAND with frequent pockets (<5mm) of grey sandy clay. Sand is fine and medium.
Dark brownish grey slightly clayey SAND. Sand is fine and medium.
Greyish brown, locally slightly silty, SAND with occasional lenses (<2mm) of brown organic matter. Sand is fine.
Recovered as dark greyish brown slightly sandy gravelly CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is angular to rounded fine to coarse of flint.

Very weak, locally extremely weak, low and medium density, white CHALK with occasional flint bands. Fractures are medium spaced, predominantly horizontal, closed, very tight, planar, rough, locally undulating and stepped, with orangish brown staining, locally open (<5mm) and infilled with fragmented extremely weak chalk and comminuted chalk; with some subvertical fractures, closed, very tight, planar, rough, occasionally with orangish brown staining. Cuckmere Beds. Grade A2.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown sandy clay with abundant rootlets.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown clayey gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular and subrounded, fine to coarse of flint, brick and concrete. Cobbles are of concrete.
MADE GROUND. Light brown slightly clayey slightly gravelly sand. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine and medium of brick.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown sandy clay with abundant rootlets.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown clayey gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint, brick and concrete. Cobbles are of concrete.
MADE GROUND. Light brown slightly clayey, slightly gravelly sand. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine and medium of brick.
MADE GROUND. Brown sandy slightly gravelly clay. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint with rare brick fragments (<25mm). Driller noted with occasional cobbles with depth.
Soft yellowish brown slightly sandy slightly gravelly CLAY with laminae (<3mm) of yellowish brown sand. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint.
Dense becoming very dense yellowish brown SAND and GRAVEL with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint. Cobbles are subangular of flint (<100mm).
Stiff and very stiff fissured dark brown silty CLAY with a little mica. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, generally subhorizontal and vertical, planar and undulating and smooth. Unit A3.

Very stiff fissured indistinctly laminated greyish brown slightly sandy CLAY with occasional partings of light brown fine sand and possible burrows infilled with fine sand. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and undulating and smooth. Unit A3.
Very stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with occasional partings of light brown fine sand. Fissures are closely spaced, subhorizontal and vertical, planar, smooth, polished and clean. Unit A3.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown slightly sandy CLAY with occasional partings of light brown fine sand, occasional pockets (<20mm) of white foraminifera and occasional burrows (<20mm) infilled with light brown silt / fine sand. Fissures are closely spaced subhorizontal and vertical, planar, smooth and rough, polished and clean. Unit A2.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown slightly sandy CLAY with a little mica, occasional laminae and very thin layers of silt and fine sand, occasional pockets of foraminifera (<40mm) and occasional burrows (<40mm) infilled with light brown silt. Fissures are closely spaced, subhorizontal, locally vertical, smooth, planar, locally undulating and polished. Unit A2.
Very stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with a little mica. Fissures are closely spaced, horizontal and vertical, planar locally undulating, smooth and polished. Unit A2.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown slightly sandy silty CLAY with a little mica, occasional laminae of silt and fine sand and occasional burrows infilled with light brown silt and rare foraminifera. Unit A2.
Recovered as firm greenish grey sandy gravelly glauconitic CLAY. Gravel is rounded and well rounded fine to coarse of black flint.
Very stiff slightly friable greenish grey glauconitic sandy and very sandy CLAY with frequent shell fragments (<60mm).
Very stiff dark grey silty CLAY thickly laminated to very thinly bedded with light grey SILT and with rare shell fragments.
Firm to hard thinly laminated dark grey CLAY with some shells.

Very stiff fissured brown mottled bluish grey and yellowish brown slightly sandy CLAY. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, locally planar, frequently polished and locally striated.
Light brown mottled grey silty SAND indistinctly laminated to very thinly bedded with thin laminae of grey sandy CLAY.
Stiff and very stiff light to dark grey silty CLAY thinly laminated with thin laminae of fine SAND.
Very stiff dark grey thinly and thickly laminated dark grey CLAY with occasional partings of light grey silt and occasional shelly laminae, horizons and thin beds.

Very stiff and hard fissured bluish grey mottled yellowish brown slightly sandy CLAY with occasional bands of calcrete. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, polished and locally striated.
Very stiff fissured green mottled red, purple and yellow, slightly sandy CLAY. Fissures are closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth, polished and striated.
Recovered as soft orangish brown and red slightly sandy, gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine of brown and black flint.
Recovered as firm and stiff red mottled green and yellow slightly sandy gravelly CLAY. Gravel is rounded and well rounded, medium and coarse of black flint.
ASSESSED ZONE OF CORE LOSS.
Recovered as soft and firm green sandy slightly gravelly glauconitic CLAY. Gravel is well rounded, fine and medium of black flint.
Green mottled yellowish brown clayey glauconitic SAND / sandy CLAY with rare shell fragments.
Greenish grey sandy glauconitic CLAY.
Brownish grey silty SAND. Sand is fine and medium.
Brown grey sandy gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular and subangular of brown and black flint.

Very weak and weak medium density white CHALK with grey burrows (<4mm x 60mm) and occasional flints. Fractures are predominantly medium spaced, subhorizontal with some inclined (12 to 60 degrees) and rare subvertical, generally open (<1mm), planar and undulating, smooth occasionally rough with slight comminuted chalk infill. With occasional subhorizontal fractures, open (20-50mm), planar, smooth and infilled with fragmented chalk and occasional comminuted chalk. Cuckmere Beds. Grade B2.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown clayey sand with abundant rootlets.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown clayey slightly gravelly sand with occasional rootlets. Gravel is angular and subangular, fine and medium of brick.
MADE GROUND. Dark brown and orangish brown silty clay with occasional rootlets.

MADE GROUND. Yellowish brown mottled brown slightly sandy slightly gravelly clay with occasional pockets (<70mm) of brown slightly sandy clay, occasional roots (<1mm) and occasional black carbonaceous material. Sand is fine. Gravel is angular and subangular, predominantly fine and medium of flint with rare brick and slag fragments (<25mm).

MADE GROUND. Brown slightly clayey gravelly sand with occasional pockets (<50mm) of black and brown silty clay and rare roots (<1mm). Gravel is very angular to rounded, fine to coarse of flint with rare brick fragments (<2mm).
Very stiff brown sandy slightly gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint.
Medium dense becoming dense yellowish brown silty very sandy GRAVEL. Sand is coarse. Gravel is very angular to rounded, predominantly fine and medium of black, brown and white flint.

Soft and firm brown slightly gravelly CLAY with occasional to frequent pockets (<50mm) and lenses (<10mm) of yellowish brown coarse sand. Gravel is angular to rounded, predominantly fine and medium of flint.
Firm and stiff fissured brownish grey CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and undulating and smooth. Unit A3.

Firm and stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY with rare burrows (<1mm) infilled with bluish grey clay. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly oriented, planar, occasionally undulating and smooth. Unit A3.

Stiff and very stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with occasional partings and lenses (<1mm) of light brown fine sand with rare foraminifera. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and smooth. Unit A3.
Stiff and very stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and smooth. Unit A3.

Very stiff fissured dark brownish grey silty CLAY with rare pockets (<4mm) of light brown fine sand, rare burrows (<1mm) infilled with grey clay, locally with rare black lignite fragments (<1mmx7mmx10mm) and foraminifera (<1mmx3mm). Fissures are extremely closely, locally very closely spaced, randomly orientated and planar. Unit A2.

Very stiff locally stiff fissured thickly laminated greyish brown slightly sandy silty CLAY and silty clay with rare pockets (<10mm) of tightly packed foraminifera on sandy layers and rare lignite fragments (<10mm). Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated and planar. Unit A2.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown becoming grey mottled brown silty CLAY, locally with rare to occasional burrows (<1mm) infilled with grey clay. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated and planar. Unit A2.
Very stiff dark grey silty CLAY with rare, locally abundant bivalve shell fragments (<10mm), rare gastropod shell fragments (<10mm) and locally with rare pockets (<5mm) of very stiff / hard clay.
Weak and medium strong greyish brown fine grained SANDSTONE with some shells (<30mm) of various bivalves with one intact gastropod shell (40mm long).
Very stiff fissured greenish grey and brown becoming mottled reddish brown CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and occasionally polished.
Dense becoming very dense brown slightly clayey SAND with occasional pockets (<30mm) recovered as soft and firm greenish grey clay. Sand is fine and medium.

Very stiff fissured dark grey and grey silty CLAY with occasional to abundant bivalve shell fragments (<30mm), rare lenses (<1mm) of light brown and grey silt, occasional burrows (<2mm) infilled with black silt and rare pyrite nodules (<10mm). Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and occasionally polished.
Very stiff fissured light greenish grey mottled yellowish brown and purplish brown CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and occasionally polished.
Very dense brown slightly silty sandy GRAVEL with rare pockets (<30mm) of light greenish grey clay. Gravel is very angular to very rounded, fine to coarse of black, red and brown flint.

Very stiff mottled bluish green, yellowish brown and reddish purple, slightly sandy slightly gravelly silty CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is rounded, rarely very angular, predominantly coarse, of brown, black, green and white flint.
Very stiff bluish green mottled yellowish brown sandy slightly gravelly glauconitic CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is predominantly rounded coarse of black and green flint.

Very dense greenish brown speckled pinkish purple clayey locally slightly gravelly SAND with rare to occasional pockets (<20mm) of stiff sandy clay. Sand is predominantly fine and medium. Gravel is angular, fine and medium of flint.
Brown clayey becoming silty SAND with occasional lenses (1-2mm thick) of carbonaceous material. Sand is fine and medium.
Stiff greyish brown sandy CLAY.
Greenish grey slightly silty sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine to coarse of black flint.

Very weak and weak medium density white CHALK with occasional flints (<120mm), cortex (generally <1mm, rarely 2mm), and occasional light grey and dark grey burrows (5-15mm). Fractures are predominantly medium spaced, subhorizontal, open (<3mm), undulating and rough and subvertical open (<3mm), undulating and smooth. Cuckmere Beds. Grade B2.

Weak medium density white CHALK with occasional flints (<120mm), cortex (generally <1mm, rarely 2mm), and occasional light grey and dark grey burrows (5-15mm). Fractures are widely spaced, subhorizontal, open (<50mm), undulating, rough, locally stained brown and infilled with chalk and subvertical, closed, tight, cemented and open (<3mm), undulating and smooth and rough. Cuckmere Beds. Grade A1.
MADE GROUND. Tarmacadam.
MADE GROUND. Reinforced concrete.

MADE GROUND. Dark orangish brown clayey gravelly sand with occasional cobbles. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine to coarse of brick and concrete with rare angular fine and medium clinker. Cobbles are subangular of brick.
Orangish brown clayey slightly gravelly SAND. Gravel is subangular and subrounded fine and medium of flint.
Very soft and soft becoming soft brown and grey sandy slightly gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular to subrounded fine to coarse of brown flint.
Dense locally very dense brown sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is angular to subrounded fine to coarse of brown, grey and light brown flint.

Firm and stiff indistinctly fissured greyish brown sandy CLAY with occasional pockets (<30mm) of brown silty sand. Fissures are possibly extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated and undulating.

Stiff becoming very stiff fissured brown silty CLAY with very closely spaced becoming medium spaced partings and thin laminae (<2mm) of light brown and occasionally black fine sand and silt and occasional to frequent pockets (<20mm) and lenses (<50mm) of light brown and black fine sand and silt. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, predominantly subhorizontal and subvertical, planar, smooth, occasionally slightly polished becoming very polished. Unit A3ii.
Very stiff fissured brown CLAY. Fissures are predominantly very closely spaced, subhorizontal and subvertical, planar, smooth and very polished. Unit A3i.

Very stiff fissured greyish brown slightly sandy silty CLAY with abundant partings (<2mm), lenses (<4mmx<40mm) and pockets (20mm) of light brown and black slightly silty fine sand and abundant to occasional pockets (<30mm) of white foraminifera, occasional burrows (4mmx<40mm) infilled with light brown and light grey fine sand / silt and locally with mica. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, predominantly subvertical, planar, smooth and slightly polished. Unit A2

Very stiff greyish brown slightly sandy silty CLAY with occasional pockets (<15mm) and lenses (2mmx20mm) of light brown and black slightly silty fine sand, occasional pockets (<20mm) of white foraminifera, occasional burrows (2mmx40mm) infilled with light grey silt, occasional pockets (<5mm) of glauconite and much mica.
Very stiff and hard brownish grey sandy silty CLAY with abundant shells. Sand is fine. Shells are predominantly oysters and bivalves (2mmx<20mm).
Stiff thinly and thickly laminated silty CLAY with laminae and partings (<2mm) of light grey slightly silty fine SAND.
Very stiff and hard dark brownish grey silty CLAY with abundant shelly beds and claystones.
Stiff light brownish grey clayey SILT.

Very stiff fissured predominantly brown mottled greyish blue, brownish red and yellowish brown locally silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, predominantly inclined (45 degrees), undulating, smooth and polished.
Very stiff thinly laminated grey and brownish grey silty CLAY with very closely spaced partings and thin laminae of light grey fine sandy SILT.
Very stiff fissured dark grey and black CLAY with occasional partings of light grey silt and occasional bivalve shell fragments.

Very stiff fissured locally friable bluish grey and yellowish brown silty CLAY. Fissures are predominantly very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, occasionally subhorizontal, undulating, smooth and rough, occasionally striated and polished.

GRAVEL in a greenish brown sandy clay matrix. Gravel is subrounded to well rounded, medium and coarse of black and dark brown flint.
Dark green clayey gravelly glauconitic SAND. Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is predominantly well rounded, medium of dark brown flint.
Orangish brown becoming light greenish and dark greenish brown clayey slightly glauconitic SAND with occasional pockets (<20mm) of grey clay. Sand is fine and medium.
Brownish light grey becoming dark grey slightly silty SAND with occasional to abundant pockets (<10mm) of black fine sand. Sand is fine.
Weak and very weak, medium and high density white CHALK with flint bands and occasional burrows. Natural fractures not observed. Cuckmere Beds. Possibly Grade A1.
Brown and grey GRAVEL. Gravel is very angular to rounded, medium and coarse of flint.
Soft and firm grey silty CLAY with frequent pockets (<4mmx5mm) of brown fine sandy silt and occasional lenses (<4mmx10mm) of grey fine sand.
Firm and stiff grey silty CLAY with occasional burrows (<2mm) infilled with grey silty clay and occasional pockets (<5mmx10mm) of firm grey predominantly fine sandy clay.
Stiff brown sandy CLAY with rare fine sand sized mica and occasional pockets (<5mmx5mm) and lenses (<3mmx10mm) of brown predominantly fine sand.

Stiff brown fissured, locally slightly sandy, locally silty, CLAY with rare fine sand sized mica and rare to occasional burrows (<3mm) infilled with grey silty clay. Sand is fine and medium. Fissures are possibly extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, rough and smooth. Unit A3?
Stiff and very stiff dark brownish grey slightly sandy, locally silty, CLAY with occasional burrows (<2mmx10mm) infilled with dark grey silt. Sand is fine. Unit A3?
Very stiff fissured brown CLAY. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and smooth. Unit A3i.

Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and rough. Unit A2.

Very stiff brown mottled bluish grey sandy CLAY with occasional pockets (<14mmx25mm) of light brown and bluish grey fine and medium sand.

Very stiff indistinctly fissured brown mottled bluish grey CLAY. Fissures are predominantly closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating and polished.
Very stiff and hard dark brownish grey CLAY.

Very stiff fissured dark brownish grey thinly laminated CLAY with extremely closely and very closely spaced partings (<1mm) and laminae (<5mm) of grey silt and light brown silty fine sand and with occasional pockets (<24mmx35mm) of light brown fine sand. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, subhorizontal, planar and smooth.

Recovered as firm becoming stiff dark brownish grey sandy CLAY with abundant predominantly bivalve shell fragments (<24mmx33mm) and occasional pyritised wood fragments (<40mmx45mm). Sand is fine and medium.

Very stiff indistinctly fissured multicoloured (greyish blue and white mottled brown, yellow and purple) CLAY with abundant nodules (60mmx60mmx70mm) of extremely weak and weak creamish white calcrete. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and undulating, smooth and polished.

Very stiff fissured multicoloured (orangish brown and red mottled bluish grey and purple) CLAY. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and undulating, smooth, polished and striated.

Stiff brown mottled bluish grey sandy, locally silty CLAY with extremely closely spaced partings (<1mm) and occasional pockets (<40mmx45mm) of light brown fine and medium sand. Sand is fine and medium.
Multicoloured (brown, orangish brown, black and red) clayey GRAVEL. Gravel is subrounded and rounded, medium and coarse of multicoloured (brown, orangish brown, black and red) flint.

Grey becoming dark grey silty SAND with occasional pockets (<20mm) of dark grey sand. Sand is fine and medium.
Light brownish grey clayey slightly sandy GRAVEL with a little comminuted chalk. Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is angular and subangular, medium and coarse of black flint.
Very weak low density white CHALK. Unable to determine fracture spacing.

Grey and brown sandy GRAVEL. Sand is predominantly medium and coarse. Gravel is very angular to well rounded, fine to coarse of flint with occasional angular and subangular brick fragments (<30mmx50mm).
Grey and dark grey sandy and very sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is very angular to subrounded, fine to coarse of flint.
Firm grey silty CLAY with rare burrows (<1mm) infilled with light grey silty clay. Unit A3?

Firm and stiff fissured greyish brown silty CLAY with possibly extremely closely and very closely spaced thin laminae (<3mm), and some lenses (<4mmx10mm) and pockets (<2mmx4mm) of light brown silty fine sand. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and rough. Unit A3.
Firm and stiff, locally stiff, fissured brown CLAY. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and smooth. Unit A3.

Stiff and very stiff fissured brownish grey silty CLAY with a little fine sand sized mica and medium spaced partings (<1mm) of light brown and dark grey fine sand. Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and slightly polished. Unit A3ii.

Very stiff fissured brownish grey, locally silty CLAY with a little fine sand sized mica and rare burrows (<1mmx15mm) infilled with light grey silt. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, smooth and polished. Unit A3i.

Very stiff fissured dark greyish brown thickly to very thinly interbedded silty CLAY and sandy CLAY, with a little fine sand sized mica, locally with very closely spaced thin laminae (<5mm) of light brown fine sand and occasional to abundant foraminifera (<1mmx5mm). Sand is fine and medium. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar, rough, locally smooth and locally polished. Unit A2.
Very stiff dark greyish brown slightly glauconitic sandy CLAY. Sand is fine and medium.

Very stiff and hard thinly laminated dark grey silty CLAY with extremely closely and very closely spaced dustings and partings (<1mm) of light grey silt and occasional to abundant bivalve shells and shell fragments (<5mmx30mmx55mm).
Light grey SAND. Sand is fine and medium.
Medium strong light grey SILTSTONE.

Very stiff and hard fissured dark grey CLAY with occasional to abundant bivalve shells and shell fragments (<4mmx20mm). Fissures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, subhorizontal, planar and smooth.

Very stiff and hard indistinctly fissured bluish grey mottled brown, slightly sandy, locally silty CLAY. Sand is fine. Fissures are possibly very closely and closely spaced, randomly orientated, undulating, rough, slightly polished and rarely striated.
Very stiff fissured brown mottled bluish grey, locally silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, planar and undulating, smooth, striated and polished.
Stiff and very stiff dark grey silty CLAY thinly interlaminated with light grey silt and light brown silty sand. Sand is fine and medium.
Very weak and extremely weak, locally friable, yellowish white nodular CALCRETE.

Very stiff and hard, locally friable, fissured multicoloured (yellowish brown mottled bluish grey, purple and red), locally silty CLAY. Fissures are very closely and closely spaced, inclined (40-60 degrees), undulating, smooth, polished and striated.
Recovered as GRAVEL. Gravel is rounded and well rounded, medium and coarse of multicoloured (black, brown, grey and white) flint.
Very stiff and hard mottled yellowish brown and green, slightly sandy gravelly CLAY. Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is subrounded to well rounded, medium and coarse of brown and black flint.

Very stiff and hard greenish grey mottled yellowish brown glauconitic sandy slightly gravelly CLAY. Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is subrounded to well rounded, medium and coarse of brown and black flint.
Recovered as firm greenish grey mottled yellowish brown sandy CLAY. Sand is fine and medium.
Recovered as GRAVEL. Gravel is subangular to well rounded, fine to coarse of predominantly brown and black flint.
Yellowish brown mottled greyish green slightly glauconitic slightly clayey SAND. Sand is fine and medium.
Recovered as firm greenish grey slightly glauconitic becoming glauconitic, sandy and very sandy CLAY. Sand is fine and medium.
Brownish grey silty SAND. Sand is fine and medium.
Dark grey slightly clayey becoming clayey SAND. Sand is fine and medium.

Recovered as GRAVEL and COBBLES in a matrix of greenish grey sandy clay and white comminuted chalk. Sand is fine and medium. Gravel and cobbles are very angular and subangular of black flint (<70mmx80mmx100mm), white cortex (<5mm) with green staining on surfaces.

Very weak and weak low and medium density greyish white CHALK with widely spaced zones of subvertical, occasionally inclined (60-75 degrees) fractures. Fractures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, closed to partly open, planar, smooth, locally rough, with rare slight orange staining. Haven Brow Beds. Grade B1 based on fracture spacing / Grade B4-B5 based on subvertical fracture sets.

Very weak and weak low and medium density greyish white CHALK with medium spaced zones of subvertical, occasionally inclined (70-75 degrees) fractures. Fractures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, closed to partly open, planar, rarely stepped, smooth and rough. Haven Brow Beds. Grade B2 based on fracture spacing / Grade B4-B5 based on subvertical fracture sets.

Weak low and medium density greyish white and white CHALK. Fractures are widely spaced, subhorizontal, open, undulating occasionally planar, rough with a little brown staining. Cuckmere Beds. Grade B1.

Weak low and medium density greyish white and white CHALK. Fractures are medium spaced, inclined (70 degrees) and occasionally horizontal, partly open, planar, occasionally undulating and rough. Cuckmere Beds. Grade B2.
Grey slightly sandy GRAVEL. Gravel is angular to rounded fine to coarse of flint and other mixed lithologies.
Stiff and very stiff, locally firm, grey CLAY with rare possibly fine sand sized selenite crystals. Unit B?

Stiff and very stiff fissured grey CLAY with occasional to frequent pockets and lenses (<10mmx30mm) of grey silty fine sand. Fissures are very closely spaced, randomly orientated, planar and rough. Unit A3.

Stiff and very stiff, fissured, grey CLAY with possibly very closely and closely spaced partings (<2mm) of grey silty fine sand. Fissures are extremely closely spaced, subhorizontal and subvertical, planar and smooth. Unit A3.
Very stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY. Fissures are closely and medium spaced, generally subvertical and subhorizontal, planar, smooth, locally polished. Unit A3ii.
Very stiff fissured greyish brown CLAY. Fissures are possibly very closely and closely spaced, generally subvertical, planar and smooth. Unit A3i.

Very stiff locally fissured dark greyish brown locally silty CLAY with predominantly medium spaced dustings and partings and occasional, locally frequent, pockets and lenses (<15mm) of light brown and light grey fine sand and silt, and occasional to frequent tubular foraminifera (<3mm). Fissures are possibly medium spaced, subvertical, undulating and planar, smooth and rough, locally polished. Unit A2.
Very stiff brownish grey slightly sandy slightly glauconitic CLAY. Sand is fine
Very stiff dark grey CLAY with abundant bivalve shells and shell fragments (<10mm).
Very stiff thinly laminated dark grey CLAY with extremely closely and very closely spaced dustings and partings of light grey silt.
Medium strong locally weak brownish grey calcareous MUDSTONE with occasional bivalve shells (<10mm).
Hard light grey CLAY cemented with abundant bivalve shells and shell fragments (<20mm).
Very stiff greenish grey SILT.
Very stiff greenish grey becoming mottled brown and grey silty CLAY.
Very stiff bluish grey mottled brownish red slightly sandy silty CLAY. Sand is fine.
Very stiff mottled brown, grey and red silty CLAY.

Very stiff fissured brown mottled bluish grey CLAY. Fissures are medium spaced, generally inclined (10 to 30 degrees), undulating and polished. Locally with extremely closely spaced fissures with polished surfaces.
Light brown silty SAND. Sand is fine.
ASSESSED ZONE OF CORE LOSS. (Flush contained fine sand and shell fragments).

Very stiff thinly laminated grey and brownish grey CLAY with very closely and closely spaced dustings and partings of fine sand / silt, frequent pockets and lenses (<80mm) of fine sand and silt, occasional shell fragments (<10mm) and occasional lignite fragments (<5mm).
Very stiff grey becoming dark grey CLAY with abundant bivalve shells (<10mm).
Very stiff grey locally mottled greenish brown and purple CLAY with frequent nodules (<60mm) of hard light brown / creamish white calcrete.
Very stiff multicoloured (mottled brown, purple, orange, grey and red) CLAY, locally with extremely closely spaced fissures with polished surfaces.
Very stiff thinly laminated brown mottled bluish grey slightly sandy silty CLAY with extremely closely spaced dustings and partings of fine sand. Sand is fine.
ASSESSED ZONE OF CORE LOSS.
Very stiff orange mottled greenish grey slightly sandy slightly gravelly silty CLAY. Sand is fine. Gravel is rounded fine to coarse of brown, orange and white flint.
ASSESSED ZONE OF CORE LOSS.
Recovered as GRAVEL. Gravel is rounded medium and coarse of predominantly brown with occasional black and white flint.
Very stiff dark greenish grey sandy CLAY. Sand is fine.
Dark greenish grey clayey SAND. Sand is fine.
Greyish brown silty SAND, locally with pockets (<5mm) of dark brown organic material.
Brown silty SAND. Sand is fine.
Brown slightly sandy gravelly CLAY. Gravel is angular to subrounded fine to coarse of black flint with glauconitic staining.

Extremely weak and very weak low and medium density white CHALK with medium spaced zones of subvertical fractures. Subvertical fractures are possibly very closely spaced, closed, very tight, planar and undulating, rough, locally with dark greyish brown staining. Haven Brow Beds. Grade A2 based on fracture spacing / Grade A4 based on subvertical fracture sets.

Extremely weak and very weak low and medium density white CHALK with widely spaced zones of subvertical and inclined (70 to 80 degrees) fractures. Fractures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, closed, very tight, planar, rough and smooth. Haven Brow Beds. Grade A1 based on fracture spacing / Grade A4-A5 based on subvertical fracture sets.

Very weak locally extremely weak, low and medium density white CHALK with widely spaced zones of subvertical fractures. Fractures are extremely closely and very closely spaced, closed, very tight, planar, smooth and rough. Grade A1 based on fracture spacing / Grade A4-A5 based on subvertical fracture sets.

Weak medium density white CHALK with some grey trace fossils (5-10mm diameter by 20-70mm length). Discontinuities: 1) very closely spaced 88-90 deg planar smooth closed. (SEAFORD CHALK FORMATION - HAVEN BROW BEDS) (CIRIA GRADE A4)
Gravels, sand and CLAY. (Driller's description)
SAND GRAVELS. (Driller's description)
Brown London CLAY. (Driller's description)
London CLAY with claystone. (Driller's description)

Stiff greyish brown slightly sandy CLAY with many lenses of light grey silty fine sand (1-5mm diameter by 10-30mm length) and some light grey silt tubes (foraminifera) (<1mm diameter by 1-2mm length). Sand is fine. (LONDON CLAY FORMATION - A2)

Stiff brown slightly sandy CLAY with some pockets of dark green clayey fine sand (2-5mm diameter by 5-20mm length) (glauconitic) and occasional brown shell fragments (1-2mm thick by 1-3mm length). (HARWICH FORMATION - SWANSCOMBE MEMBER)

Stiff fissured dark grey CLAY with many lenses of light grey silt (1-2mm thick by 10-80mm length) and some light brown and white shell fragments (1-2mm thick by 2-6mm length). Fissures are very closely spaced randomly orientated planar smooth locally polished. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER SHELLY BEDS)
Stiff fissured light bluish grey mottled red and brown CLAY. Fissures are very closely to closely spaced randomly orientated planar polished. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER MOTTLED BEDS)
Stiff to very stiff fissured brown mottled light bluish grey CLAY. Fissures are very closely to medium spaced randomly orientated planar smooth polished. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER MOTTLED BEDS)

Stiff fissured light greenish brown mottled light bluish grey silty CLAY with occasional nodules of white calcrete (1-5mm diameter by 5-20mm length). Fissures are very closely spaced 0-5 deg planar smooth polished. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPPER MOTTLED BEDS)
Stiff thinly laminated dark grey silty CLAY. Laminations are extremely closely spaced of light grey silt. (LAMBETH GROUP - LAMINATED BEDS)
Assumed zone of core loss.
Firm to stiff thinly laminated dark grey silty CLAY. Laminations are extremely closely spaced of light grey silt. (LAMBETH GROUP - LAMINATED BEDS)
Greyish brown very clayey fine and medium SAND. (LAMBETH GROUP - LAMINATED BEDS - SAND CHANNEL)

Stiff fissured thinly laminated dark grey CLAY with some light brown and white shell fragments (1mm diameter by 1-30mm length). Laminations are extremely closely spaced infilled with grey silt. Fissures are very closely to closely spaced randomly orientated planar smooth. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER SHELLY BEDS)
Very stiff light grey mottled light greenish brown CLAY with some nodules of medium strong to strong calcrete (10-20mm thick by 20-50mm length). (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)
Very stiff fissured reddish brown mottled light bluish grey CLAY. Fissures are very closely to closely spaced randomly orientated planar smooth polished. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)
No recovery.
Soft to firm reddish brown mottled greenish grey slightly sandy CLAY with occasional subrounded fine gravel of black flint. Sand is fine. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)

Reddish brown mottled greenish grey slightly sandy very clayey subrounded to rounded medium and coarse GRAVEL of black locally stained green flint. With occasional pockets of reddish brown mottled grey clay (10-40mm length). Sand is fine. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)
Assumed zone of core loss.

Firm dark green slightly sandy gravelly CLAY with occasional pockets of brown fine sand (5-10mm length). Sand is fine and medium. Gravel is subrounded to rounded fine and medium of brown flint. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)
No recovery.
Greenish brown mottled greenish grey slightly clayey fine and medium SAND. (LAMBETH GROUP - LOWER MOTTLED BEDS)
Brownish green fine and medium SAND. (LAMBETH GROUP - UPNOR FORMATION)
Dark greenish grey slightly silty fine and medium SAND with many pockets of grey fine and medium sand (5-40mm length). (LAMBETH GROUP - UPNOR FORMATION)

Grey slightly silty fine and medium SAND with occasional lenses of black slightly sandy clay (2mm diameter by 3-6mm length) and many lenses of light grey silty fine sand (1-4mm diameter by 4-10mm length). (THANET SAND FORMATION)
Assumed zone of core loss.
No recovery.
